runs.comm: Kieswetter is off the mark immediately with a nudge to leg
and Lumb follows his example, tucking one of his pads to get off the mark
well, Kieswetter isn't going to waste any time here! There's no pressure on him today, and he's going to play his shots from the off. This one is lifted to wide long on with a lot of bottom hand
That's huge! Kieswetter charges out to meet the ball on the half volley and lifts it right back over McCullum's head for a monstrous six!
level-headed from Kieswetter, keeping a good ball out
tickled off the pads for a single
Bond hits a length first up, and Kieswetter drives softly into the covers on the up
short, and Kieswetter got himself into a bit of a tangle going for the pull. The ball struck the thigh pad and the glove and evaded a diving Hopkins to reach the boundary
Kieswetter backs away for what is already becoming his signature shot, the attempted smear between mid off and cover, but picks out the fielder
flicked off his legs for one
Bond strays onto the pads of the left-hander too, and Lumb takes full advantage to pick up another boundary! New Zealand are leaking runs here
much better, hitting the deck hard and cramping Lumb for room, no run
Kieswetter comes down the pitch and across to leg, swishing right across his front pad. He missed, and turns down the run
stays deep in the crease this time, getting on top of the ball and finding the gap on the leg side to pick up two

gone! Kieswetter gave himself room to try and slap the ball up and over the off side, but couldn't get underneath the ball. He timed the pants off it, but the ball went straight to McCullum at cover point and he held the sharp chance!
on the hips, clipped just wide of short fine leg
they don't need that! Full and wide from Mills, Lumb leans across to caress the ball through the covers. The ball slows up in the huge outfield though, and is cut off inches from the rope
length and wobbling just a touch through the air on its way to the batsman, and Bopara gets right  behind it in solid defence
on a length, Lumb went for the pull but it wasn't short enough for the shot, the ball sneaks under bat and Bond is left holding his head. That was close to the edge and the stumps
full and fast from Bond, Lumb is late on the shot and is lucky to get an inside edge on it as the ball cannons into his pads

well, he barely seemed to hit that, but it's turned out to be an 81-metre six! The ball was full, and Lumb simply went through with a lofted on drive, and timed it very well to get the ball over the ropes
Bond stays full, and Lumb drives hard into the covers

dropped! Bond pulled the length back, Lumb tried to guide the ball down to third man but got a thick edge. Hopkins leapt into the air and just about got his left hand to the flashing chance, but it couldn't hold it. A very, very tough chance, but his team needed him to snatch it
Lumb opts for watchful defence this time
Bopara shimmies down the track and flat-bats a meaty pull over mid on. Good shot
full and skidding in to the pads, worked away on the leg side for one
Lumb charges down the track, the ball drops at his feet of a bottom edge and Bopara calls him through for one. The attempted kick onto the stumps from Mills is wide, and Bopara is safely through
Bopara swishes airily outside off stump at a slightly slower cutter, and the ball scoots past the edge
Bopara uses his feet once again and swings to leg, but picks out the man in the deep
Lumb comes down the track again, and clubs the ball down to long on
not the best of starts from the skipper. The ball pitched leg to the left-hander, and spun further down leg, clipping the pad and they collect one
full and clipped off the toes out to midwicket
Lumb gets the sweep out, and sends the ball racing out to the boundary behind square. Good connection on the shot, and New Zealand are starting to deflate just a touch
full ball is slapped straight to the cover fielder
another superb sweep from Lumb! It has been said he has a weakness to spin, but he's not showing it here, powerfully swept all along the turf
and Lumb finishes the over with one down to long on
very full, almost a yorker, but there's a touch of width on it, and Lumb sends the ball out to the cover sweeper
tight line from Styris, and the ball wobbles through the air a touch too to elicit a forward defensive from Bopara
paddle sweep from Bopara! But there's a fielder on the boundary to cut it off
firmly clipped out to deep midwicket

there goes another one! Bopara falls in very similar fashion to Kieswetter, giving himself some room and slashing through the off side. This time it's extra cover that takes a sharp chance - that ball was travelling! Is that the moment of inspiration New Zealand needed? A wicket certainly won't hurt their cause...
immediately nurdled by Colly, but there's a fielder at a close midwicket just for that nurdly shot, and he cuts it off
leg stump line from Vettori, tapped straight to the fielder on the leg side though

gone! Vettori strikes! That was a really slow, loopy ball, Lumb went to sweep but missed it completely, was struck on the back leg and that is utterly adjacent! He was plumb, and Umpire Taufel was quick in the decision.
ooh, nervy little fiddle outside off stump from Morgan, and Vettori is clutching his head as that just evades the edge
flighty again, and tapped to midwicket
Morgan is off the mark, flicking off the toes to the leg side
Collingwood uses his feet, coming down the track and dropping the ball on the leg side. Morgan charges through, and Collingwood keeps the strike
pushed down to long on, easy one taken
chopped out square on the off side, the fielder runs in to keep them to one
athletic attempt by McCullum at midwicket, but he can't stop the push off the back foot from Collingwood, and that's another run to long on
on the hips, and nudged to leg to rotate the strike
driven straight mid off
Styris gets another one! He really slowed that one up, it was a very slow offcutter and Colly was into the nurdle too soon, clipping straight to McCullum at midwicket. New Zealand are ecstatic!
Morgan drives back to the bowler, who cuts it off.... eventually, after one or two fumbles
very slow indeed from Vettori, and clipped straight to short midwicket
brilliant stop! It's McCullum again - Brendon - and he's leapt off his feet to cut that one off
that's one way to beat the fielder - chipped up and over McCullum, and short of the fielder on the boundary
Wright is back and across in defence
very slow again, and full, and Wright jams it off his toes and out to square leg. They decided against a second as the fielder sprints in
nudged off the pads for one
full and wobbly from Styris, Morgan keeps his eye on it and sends the ball to the point fielder
offcutter, just a touch too short and Morgan rocks back to cut but Ryder at backward point goes airborne to cut it off, setting off minor tremors...
tickled just wide of short fine leg for one
well, well. Morgan has hit that one-handed and it has sailed over wide long on. It looked like a little chip, but it just kept on going! Amazing shot! 84 metres!
tapped softly to midwicket this time, no run
quick and back of a length, Wright gets across to nudge down to fine leg
huge shout from New Zealand! Morgan went to paddle the ball to leg, it was very full and thumped into the pad, but just outside off stump. Taufel says no...
slapped very hard off the back foot square on the off side. Not quite an upper cut, not the regulation cut, somewhere inbetween, but middled all the same
Wright charges out and hoicks, but Butler slips in a slower cutter wide of off to beat his flailing bat
well, that's an uncomplicated slog from Wright, and it's effective! Crashed between long on and deep midwicket for four
four runs! Slog-swept by Wright, and there was a fielder out there on the boundary but it sailed to his right
Morgan dances down and drives down to long on
Wright uses his feet as well, but McCullum sees him coming and slips in a quicker one to keep the batsman quiet
swept hard out to square leg
chipped back towards the bowler, McCullum dives to his left to cut it off
what a shot! Total confidence from Morgan as he drives majestically over the covers, the ball bounces just inside the boundary marker. Middled.
Morgan swipes to leg this time, and they run hard to pick up two
good placement by Wright, finding the gap between the men at long on and deep midwicket to pick up a couple, and all along the ground too!
Wright comes down the track and slashed behind square on the off side
Vettori slows it up and Wright taps straight to backward point
too far down leg! Vettori slips in the arm ball but it starts too straight and goes on with the arm, heading down the leg side
Muscled out to midwicket off the back foot
full and clipped out to the sweeper at midwicket, one more, and England are inching closer to the win
out comes Morgan's reverse sweep! He hit it really well, but New Zealand were expecting something of the sort from him, and have a man placed out there for the shot
another reverse sweep from Morgan as McCullum slows one up, but he can't connect with this one
slipping to leg, Morgan shapes to flick it away but can't get the shot again
Morgan stays deep in the crease this time, and powers away a pull shot off the back foot. The placement was inch-perfect too, and England are gaining momentum
reverse-sweep, and he's nailed it! Where do you put the fielders? Great timing and placement on the shot
dropped just behind square on the leg side, and they charge through for one
Wright joins in now! Shovelled without mercy out to wide long on, one bounce and over the ropes and the asking rate is just above a run a ball now
length on off stump, angling across Morgan, and guided down to third man
wicket! Wright goes! Bond slipped in a slower bouncer with a man out at deep square leg, Wright takes him on but couldn't time that one, and the fielder holds on to a vital chance!
bouncer again, slightly quicker this time, and Morgan hooks out to square leg, rolling his wrists on it to keep the ball down, and sharp running gets them two
Bond bangs it in again, Morgan uppercuts but it falls well short of the fielder at third man
Bresnan hangs back to drive through the off side off the back foot to get Morgan back on strike
on the pads, dinked to leg and the batsmen cross to keep Morgan on strike
short, on the hips, Morgan gets across and sends the ball very fine down to the boundary on the leg side. The ball evades the fielder to reach the boundary, and New Zealand didn't need that!
dropped on the off side, and Morgan, as usual, finds the gap
full toss, Bresnan flaps the ball one-handed out on the leg side. It was hit in the air, but fell well short of any fielders
full ball slammed away by Bresnan, in the air with a lot of bottom hand. The old heave-ho, and New Zealand's hopes are slipping away with every run
bouncer banged in very short, Bresnan slaps it high in the air over the off side and they pick up two more
short again, Bresnan goes to pull to leg but the ball takes the toes of the bat and flies to the off side, and they pick up one as long off runs in
short and pulled powerfully down to long on, Morgan is like lightning between the wickets and they pick up two more
slower, and Bresnan just drops it at his feet on the off side to inch England closer
short again, Morgan splices the pull and the top edge looped up invitingly, but there was no fielder around when it plummeted down, and England need single figures now
slower one on off stump, Morgan has a tickle and may have got a thin edge, but the ball falls well short of Hopkins

well, Morgan's out! The ball was short again and Morgan pulled in the air infront of square. It looked to have beaten the fielder, but Vettori ran across and timed his dive perfectly to pluck the ball out of the air. What can New Zealand do from here? They're not out of this yet...
although they may be now... Back of a length and Bresnan powers the ball away off the back foot to wide long on to take the target to 4 runs...
dot ball, Yardy drives solidly back to the bowler

down goes another one! Yardy backed away to give himself room and lofted one to long off, the fielder set himself underneath it and another wicket goes down! Just 4 from 10 now, but England only have three wickets in hand...
driven through the covers, the fielder races back to cut it off and keep it to one, and Swann is on strike now
Swann gives himself some room and slaps the ball into the covers, they set off and squeak home for a tight single!
clipped out onto the leg side, the fielder cuts it off but they're level now
Swann comes down the track and looks to heave the ball over the leg side, but he misses completely and as the ball bobbles off the pad they decide against the single
there's the game! Short and Bresnan pulls it away very powerfully infront of square leg for four!
